message.ChinText: 西九文化區內所有停車場現已泊滿車輛，前往西九文化區一帶的市民請使用公共交通工具。
message.ChinShort: 西九文化區內所有停車場現已泊滿車輛，前往西九文化區一帶的市民請使用公共交通工具。
message.EngText: All car parks at West Kowloon Cultural District are full. Members of the public are encouraged to take public transport to the West Kowloon Cultural District.
message.EngShort: All car parks at West Kowloon Cultural District are full. Members of the public are encouraged to take public transport to the West Kowloon Cultural District.

message.ChinText: 較早前因車輛故障而封閉的柯士甸道西(往紅磡方向)近香港西九龍站的部份行車線現已解封。
message.ChinShort: 較早前因車輛故障而封閉的柯士甸道西(往紅磡方向)近香港西九龍站的部份行車線現已解封。
message.EngText: Part of the lanes of Austin Road West (Hung Hom bound) near Hong Kong West Kowloon Station which was closed due to vehicle breakdown is re-opened to all traffic.
message.EngShort: Part of the lanes of Austin Road West (Hung Hom bound) near Hong Kong West Kowloon Station which was closed due to vehicle breakdown is re-opened to all traffic.

message.ChinText: 因水管緊急維修，大埔公路 – 沙田段(往九龍方向)近賽馬會體藝中學的慢線現已封閉。 駕駛人士只可使用餘下行車線行車。 現時上址交通繁忙。
message.ChinShort: 因水管緊急維修，大埔公路 – 沙田段(往九龍方向)近賽馬會體藝中學的慢線現已封閉。 駕駛人士只可使用餘下行車線行車。 現時上址交通繁忙。
message.EngText: Due to watermain emergency works , the slow lane of Tai Po Road - Sha Tin (Kowloon bound) near Jockey Club TI-I College is closed to all traffic. Only remaining lanes is available to motorists. Traffic is busy now.
message.EngShort: Due to watermain emergency works , the slow lane of Tai Po Road - Sha Tin (Kowloon bound) near Jockey Club TI-I College is closed to all traffic. Only remaining lanes is available to motorists. Traffic is busy now.

message.ChinText:
第十五屆全國運動會鐵人三項項目將於本週六及週日(十一月十五及十六日)舉行。為配合比賽，中環及灣仔北一帶(包括博覽道、龍和道、耀星街、龍合街和龍達徑)會實施封路及臨時交通改道，受影響的駕駛者需改經菲林明道、干諾道中、夏慤道或告士打道。
屆時附近交通將會比平常的周六日較為擠塞，請駕駛人士小心駕駛及保持忍讓，及留意現場的交通標誌。
行經龍和道的三條專營巴士路線(城巴第H1S、H2及H3號線)在十一月十五及十六日，由首班車起改道行駛。位於民耀街國際金融中心二期對面的巴士站，亦會因應封路而暫停使用。相關巴士路線及巴士站將於道路重開後恢復正常運作。
因應賽事期間灣仔對開一帶水域設立的限制區域，來往灣仔及尖沙咀的渡輪航線預計在十一月十五日上午約七時五十分至八時二十分、上午約十時三十五分至十一時○五分；及十一月十六日下午約一時五十分至二時十分期間，或會視乎實際情況而作出短暫的臨時服務調整。水上的士於十一月十六日下午一時五十五分由尖沙咀東開出往中環的航班將不停灣仔。
運輸署呼籲市民及早計劃行程，盡量使用公共運輸服務，以避免交通擠塞及不必要的延誤。活動期間，警方將視乎當區一帶的人潮及交通情況，在有需要時調整有關交通安排。市民請留意電台、電視台或「香港出行易」流動應用程式發放的最新交通消息。
message.ChinShort:
第十五屆全國運動會鐵人三項項目將於本週六及週日(十一月十五及十六日)舉行。為配合比賽，中環及灣仔北一帶(包括博覽道、龍和道、耀星街、龍合街和龍達徑)會實施封路及臨時交通改道，受影響的駕駛者需改經菲林明道、干諾道中、夏慤道或告士打道。
屆時附近交通將會比平常的周六日較為擠塞，請駕駛人士小心駕駛及保持忍讓，及留意現場的交通標誌。

message.EngText:
The 15th National Games Triathlon Competition will be held this Saturday and Sunday (November 15 and 16). To facilitate the competition, road closures and temporary traffic diversions will be implemented in the vicinity of Central and Wan Chai North (including Expo Drive, Lung Wo Road, Yiu Sing Street, Lung Hop Street, and Lung Tat Path) and affected motorists should divert via Fleming Road, Connaught Road Central, Harcourt Road or Gloucester Road as appropriate.
The traffic will be more congested when compared with normal Saturdays and Sundays. Motorists are advised to drive with care, and pay attention to the traffic signs erected at the scenes.
Three franchised bus routes (Citybus route Nos. H1S, H2 and H3) passing through Lung Wo Road will be diverted from start of service on November 15 and 16. The bus stop located at the opposite side of Two International Finance Centre on Man Yiu Street will also be temporarily suspended due to the road closures. The relevant affected bus routes and bus stops will resume normal operation after roads re-open.
In view of the restricted zones set up at waters off Wanchai during the competition, services of the ferry route traveling between Wan Chai and Tsim Sha Tsui is expected to be temporarily adjusted from around 7.50am to 8.20am and from around 10.35am to 11.05am on November 15, and from around 1.50pm to 2.10pm on November 16, subject to the actual circumstances. The route of Water Taxi departing at 1.55pm on November 16 from Tsim Sha Tsui East to Central will not stop at Wanchai.
The Transport Department appeals to members of the public to plan their journey in advance and make use of public transport services as far as possible to avoid traffic congestion and unnecessary delays. During the event, the Police may adjust the traffic arrangements subject to the prevailing crowd and traffic conditions in the areas. Members of the public should pay attention to the latest traffic news through radio, television or the "HKeMobility" mobile application.
message.EngShort:
The 15th National Games Triathlon Competition will be held this Saturday and Sunday (November 15 and 16). To facilitate the competition, road closures and temporary traffic diversions will be implemented in the vicinity of Central and Wan Chai North (including Expo Drive, Lung Wo Road, Yiu Sing Street, Lung Hop Street, and Lung Tat Path) and affected motorists should divert via Fleming Road, Connaught Road Central, Harcourt Road or Gloucester Road as appropriate.
The traffic will be more congested when compared with normal Saturdays and Sundays. Motorists are advised to drive with care, and pay attention to the traffic signs erected at the scenes.
Three franchised bus routes (Citybus route Nos. H1S, H2 and H3) passing through Lung Wo Road will be diverted from start of service on November 15 and 16. The bus stop located at the opposite side of Two International Finance Centre on Man Yiu Street will also be temporarily suspended due to the road closures. The relevant affected bus routes and bus stops will resume normal operation after roads re-open.
In view of the restricted zones set up at waters off Wanchai during the competition, services of the ferry route traveling between Wan Chai and Tsim Sha Tsui is expected to be temporarily adjusted from around 7.50am to 8.20am and from around 10.35am to 11.05am on November 15, and from around 1.50pm to 2.10pm on November 16, subject to the actual circumstances. The route of Water Taxi departing at 1.55pm on November 16 from Tsim Sha Tsui East to Central will not stop at Wanchai.
The Transport Department appeals to members of the public to plan their journey in advance and make use of public transport services as far as possible to avoid traffic congestion and unnecessary delays. During the event, the Police may adjust the traffic arrangements subject to the prevailing crowd and traffic conditions in the areas. Members of the public should pay attention to the latest traffic news through radio, television or the "HKeMobility" mobile application.

message.ChinText:
中國內地鐵路部門通知，高速鐵路（香港段）將加開以下臨時列車車次：
由香港西九龍站前往深圳北站 ●11月19日：G9532 ●11月24日：G9534
由廣州南站前往香港西九龍站 ●11月15日：G9639 ●11月27日：G9531
由深圳北站前往香港西九龍站 ●11月22日：G9531,G9533
乘客可透過12306官方網站(12306.cn)或手機應用程式、指定代理或前往香港西九龍站購買列車車票。
有關列車服務詳情，請瀏覽12306官方網站(12306.cn)或手機應用程式、高速鐵路網頁及手機應用程式。

message.EngText:
As informed by the Chinese Mainland Railway Authorities, High Speed Rail (Hong Kong Section) will add the following temporary train trips:
From Hong Kong West Kowloon Station to Shenzhenbei Station ● 19 Nov: G9532 ● 24 Nov: G9534
From Guangzhounan Station to Hong Kong West Kowloon Station ● 15 Nov: G9639 ● 27 Nov: G9531
From Shenzhenbei Station to Hong Kong West Kowloon Station ● 22 Nov: G9531, G9533
Tickets are available for purchase through the 12306 official website (12306. cn) or mobile app; appointed travel agents; or at Hong Kong West Kowloon Station.
For train schedules, please refer to the 12306 official website (12306. cn) or mobile app, or the High Speed Rail website or mobile app.

message.ChinText: 運輸署接獲港鐵公司通知，為配合全運會香港區賽事，港鐵會於11月12日至17日加密東鐵綫部分時段的班次。
message.ChinShort: 運輸署接獲港鐵公司通知，為配合全運會香港區賽事，港鐵會於11月12日至17日加密東鐵綫部分時段的班次。
message.EngText: Transport Department has received notification from MTR Corporation Limited that to facilitate passengers watching the National Games in Hong Kong, train frequency on the East Rail Line will be increased during selected periods from 12 to 17 November.
message.EngShort: Transport Department has received notification from MTR Corporation Limited that to facilitate passengers watching the National Games in Hong Kong, train frequency on the East Rail Line will be increased during selected periods from 12 to 17 November.

message.ChinText:
為配合第十五屆全國運動會和全國第十二屆殘疾人運動會暨第九屆特殊奧林匹克運動會期間設立交通統籌指揮中心的安排，林士街停車場七樓及八樓全層(包括77個電動車充電設施)將於2025年10月2日至2025年12月30日暫停開放予公眾使用。
在上述期間，受影響的駕駛人士可繼續使用林士街停車場一樓至六樓的泊車設施或使用周邊其他停車場。現場將設置適當交通標誌，指導駕駛人士。駕駛人士請遵照現場指示，小心駕駛及保持忍讓。
如對上述安排有任何查詢，請致電 5485 4105 與全國運動會香港賽區統籌辦公室聯絡。不便之處，敬請見諒。
message.ChinShort:
為配合第十五屆全國運動會和全國第十二屆殘疾人運動會暨第九屆特殊奧林匹克運動會期間設立交通統籌指揮中心的安排，林士街停車場七樓及八樓全層(包括77個電動車充電設施)將於2025年10月2日至2025年12月30日暫停開放予公眾使用。
在上述期間，受影響的駕駛人士可繼續使用林士街停車場一樓至六樓的泊車設施或使用周邊其他停車場。現場將設置適當交通標誌，指導駕駛人士。駕駛人士請遵照現場指示，小心駕駛及保持忍讓。
如對上述安排有任何查詢，請致電 5485 4105 與全國運動會香港賽區統籌辦公室聯絡。不便之處，敬請見諒。
message.EngText:
To facilitate the arrangement of setting up a traffic coordination depot for the 15th National Games of the People’s Republic of China, the 12th National Games for Persons with Disabilities and the 9th National Special Olympic Games, the entire 7/F and 8/F (including 77 numbers of EV charging facilities) of Rumsey Street Carpark will be temporarily closed to the public from 2 October 2025 to 30 December 2025.
Affected motorists can continue to use the parking facilities on 1/F to 6/F of Rumsey Street Car Park or make use of other car parks in the vicinity during the above period. Appropriate traffic signs will be erected on site to guide motorists. Motorists are advised to follow the instructions on site and drive with care and patience.
For enquiries on the above arrangements, please contact the National Games Coordination Office (Hong Kong) at 5485 4105. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.
message.EngShort:
To facilitate the arrangement of setting up a traffic coordination depot for the 15th National Games of the People’s Republic of China, the 12th National Games for Persons with Disabilities and the 9th National Special Olympic Games, the entire 7/F and 8/F (including 77 numbers of EV charging facilities) of Rumsey Street Carpark will be temporarily closed to the public from 2 October 2025 to 30 December 2025.
Affected motorists can continue to use the parking facilities on 1/F to 6/F of Rumsey Street Car Park or make use of other car parks in the vicinity during the above period. Appropriate traffic signs will be erected on site to guide motorists. Motorists are advised to follow the instructions on site and drive with care and patience.
For enquiries on the above arrangements, please contact the National Games Coordination Office (Hong Kong) at 5485 4105. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.
